posts.post_content: It was just banned this month and combo hasn't reigned supreme so far. Just check the tournament results up to the banning. I don't know about you but I see alot of aggro decks (Merfolk and Goblins to name a couple) at the top of the list with only a smattering of combo placing high. I'm not saying Magic is getting dumbed down...I'm saying WotC just likes to cater to those that can't think more than one turn ahead. They say people like to play their creatures and have them removed rather than have them countered. I like a cerebral game where you look across the table right into you're oppenents eyes and wonder "What's next? Should I have saved that last [Force Spike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Force Spike) or are you drawing dead?" Guess that's just me though.

Posted By: TheStud (6/21/2010 9:41:02 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Yeah, most situations I'd prefer this over [Merchant Scroll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merchant Scroll), but one card in particular works much better with [Merchant Scroll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merchant Scroll): [Echo Mage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Echo Mage). In most cases, being able to pay 1UUU to tutor 3 instants to your hand would be more useful than paying UUU to put 3 instants/sorceries on top of your library. In most any other deck though, between being able to search sorceries, instant speed, and being a turn-1 play, I'd say this is the better card.  
  
Pity you have to reveal the card though. I always thought that cards that tutor instants should let you exile the card, then play it as if it were in your hand to keep it hidden from the opponent while still letting them make sure you aren't cheating with your tutors. (Damn that sounds dirty.)
posts.html:

In most any other deck though, between being able to search sorceries, instant speed, and being a turn-1 play, I'd say this is the better card.

Pity you have to reveal the card though. I always thought that cards that tutor instants should let you exile the card, then play it as if it were in your hand to keep it hidden from the opponent while still letting them make sure you aren't cheating with your tutors. (Damn that sounds dirty.)

Posted By: MrCleric (11/12/2010 5:57:04 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Merchant Scroll has advantage of timing. It brings things straight to your hand, instead of throwing them on top of your library. It's not necessarily better, but depending on the situation it can give you great advantage.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
I support the banning. This thing is WAY too cheap for what it does. Blue is known for some of the most devastating spells in the game, such as [Time Walk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Walk) , [Time Warp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Warp) , [Mind Over Matter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Over Matter) , [Brain Geyser](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brain Geyser) , [Ancestral Recall](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ancestral Recall) , [Force of Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Force of Will) , and [Tinker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tinker). Not to mention it makes the new miracle cards in Avacyn Restored stupid powerful.  
  
Do we **REALLY** want to be playing against an opponent who can search for and have those cards in his hand anytime he wants for **1 BLUE MANA?**
posts.html:
I support the banning. This thing is WAY too cheap for what it does.
